slides.text: And it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city called Nain; and many of his disciples went with him, and much people.
notes: Nain was a city located in the Lower Galilee, 14 kilometers (8.7 mi) south of Nazareth, where Jesus grew up and 3 kilomters south of Mount Tabor where Jesus was transfigured.  Cana is up here. The Sea of Galilee is over here. Capernaum is here by the Sea of Galilee. The Jordan river is this blue zigzag line here.
Abigail and I have visited some of these places for our honeymoon back in 2010.  We rented a car and traveled around Israel for 7 days. Somebody once condemned me for visiting Israel.

Ellen G. White had this to say about visiting Israel ,  'Among our workers are some who feel that a great object would be gained if their feet could tread the soil of old Jerusalem. But God's cause and work will never be advanced by His workers wandering about to find where Jesus traveled and wrought His miracles. Would you trace the footsteps of Christ, behold Him in that hovel, ministering to the poor; see Him at that sick bed, comforting the suffering, and speaking hope and courage to the desponding. Those who walk in the footsteps of Jesus will do as He did. 'Whosoever will come after me', He said,  'let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.'

But I never went there thinking I would become a better missionary, preacher or Christian after visiting Israel.  I visited Israel just like many people like to visit America, or other countries.  Visiting Israel and visiting places where Jesus traveled will not help anyone to overcome sin.  The word of God is all we need.

Now notice many of His disciples went with Him and much people.  Picture in your mind Jesus leading a huge crowd of people marching towards the city of Nain.  Because in the next verse we are about to read, there is also another huge crowd going in the opposite direction. And these two different crowds are going to meet and with Jesus being the center of attraction.
There is always something exciting happening when Jesus is around. Are you following Jesus? Following Jesus is a very exciting life.

slides.text: Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.
And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.
And he came and touched the bier: and they that bare [him] stood still. And he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.
And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he delivered him to his mother.
And there came a fear on all: and they glorified God, saying, That a great prophet is risen up among us; and, That God hath visited his people.
And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea, and throughout all the region round about.
And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.  And John calling [unto him] two of his disciples sent [them] to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
When the men were come unto him, they said, John Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
And in that same hour he cured many of [their] infirmities and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto many [that were] blind he gave sight.
